Name: Eiffel Tower
Significance: Iconic wrought-iron lattice tower, symbol of Paris, offers panoramic views.

Name: Louvre Museum
Weekly Off: World's largest art museum, home to the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo.

Name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
Significance: Historic Catholic cathedral, famous for its Gothic architecture and gargoyles.

Name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
Significance: Stunning white basilica offering incredible city views from Montmartre.

Name: Arc de Triomphe
Significance: Triumphal arch honoring those who fought for France, great views from top.

Name: Gateway of India
Significance: Historic arch monument built to commemorate the landing of King George V.

Name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya
Significance: Prominent museum in Mumbai, showcasing Indian history, art, and natural history.

Name: Red Fort
Significance: Historic fort in Delhi, served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors.

Name: India Gate
Significance: War memorial dedicated to soldiers of British India, iconic landmark.

Name: Taj Mahal
Significance: Iconic ivory-white marble mausoleum, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Name: Qutub Minar
Significance: UNESCO World Heritage Site, a minaret and victory tower.

Name: Humayun's Tomb
Significance: Tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun, precursor to the Taj Mahal.
